question: What is the full product name and model number stated on the manual’s cover?

Which accessories in the package are marked as “may vary by geographic market”?
Which iPhone models are explicitly listed as compatible with the BG5?
Which iPad models are explicitly listed as compatible with the BG5?
Which iPod touch models are explicitly listed as compatible with the BG5?
What is the minimum iOS version required to use the BG5?
For what types of samples and users is the BG5 intended (include sample type and single-patient use guidance)?
According to “Intended Use,” name two purposes for which the BG5 should not be used.
What warning is given about using Alternate Site Testing (AST) to calibrate CGMs or for insulin dosing?
Define Alternate Site Testing (AST) as described in the manual.
List all five body sites (other than the fingertip) permitted for AST with the BG5.
What are the three “steady-state” situations when AST is suitable?
Name four situations when AST should not be used (e.g., suspected hypoglycemia).
Briefly describe how the BG5 measures glucose (“How the test works?” section).
What are two general “Important Safety Instructions” about device sharing and liquids?
What caution is given about use near aerosol sprays or oxygen administration?
What does the manual advise about blocking test ports or placing the meter on soft surfaces?
State two “Important Testing Information” cautions related to dehydration and symptoms inconsistent with readings.
What sample type is required for testing (include “fresh” and “capillary” qualifiers)?
What symbol appears on the meter when it is connected to an iOS device via Bluetooth?
Where are the Memory Button and Eject Button located on the device housing?
What is the function of the Mini USB port?
Name the four labeled parts of the blood glucose test strip.
Which brand/model of test strips must be used with the BG5?
What message accompanies the CTL symbol on the display regarding memory storage?
What two measurement units can the meter display with results?
What does the flashing “blood drop” (Blood Sample Symbol) indicate?
Before first use, how is the meter time set and saved?
In setup, how long should you press and hold the Memory Button to power on for Bluetooth pairing?
What Bluetooth device name appears during pairing (format shown in the manual)?
What is the purpose of scanning the two-dimensional code on the test strip vial?
In offline mode, what starts automatically when the confirmation window is filled?
In offline mode, when does the result appear and where is it shown?
In online mode, what cue tells you to remove the strip from the blood sample?
In online mode, where are results displayed?
What reminder does the manual give about plasma calibration of results (and why it matters)?
What steps does the manual give for safely discarding used test strips?
What steps does the manual give for safely discarding used lancets?
Under what circumstances does the manual urge consulting a healthcare professional after getting results?
When should a Control Solution test be performed? List at least five triggers from the manual.
For an offline Control Solution test, how do you enter CTL mode and what does it change?
For the Control Solution drop, which drop is recommended for use and why?
What specific instruction is given to avoid contaminating the Control Solution vial?
Where should the Control Solution result fall, and where is that range printed?
List four possible causes when a Control Solution result is out of the specified range.
What phone number is provided for iHealth Labs Customer Service in the U.S.?
In the online Control Solution workflow, how do you switch the app to CTL mode?
What warning does the manual give about mistakenly saving Control Solution tests as regular tests?
How many blood-glucose results (with date/time) can the meter store in memory?
How do you review stored results on the meter, and what appears when you reach the last result?
What auto-off behavior is described when the meter is idle in memory mode?
According to the “Reference Value” table, what fasting/pre-meal glucose value is considered normal for people without diabetes?
According to the same table, what value is considered normal two hours after meals for people without diabetes?
What three “Before Going to the Lab” steps are listed for comparing meter and lab results?
During lab comparison, within what time frame should both samples be taken?
Name two sample-handling cautions given under “While at the Lab” (e.g., no test-tube blood).
Why might results from the BG5 differ from laboratory results, according to the manual?
Which disinfectant product (brand and EPA registration) does the manual recommend for cleaning the meter and lancing device?
After wiping, how long should the surface remain wet to meet the disinfection contact time?
How many cleaning+disinfection cycles does the manual estimate over a five-year life if used 5–6 times/day?
What explicit warning is given about inserting disinfecting wipes into the strip port or metal connector?
List the two public-health links (FDA and CDC topics) cited in the cleaning section and summarize their caution in one phrase.
What is the BG5’s measuring method (enzyme and technique)?
What is the BG5’s result range in mg/dL and mmol/L?
What is the stated power source specification (voltage and battery capacity)?
What Bluetooth version/class/profile and frequency band are listed in the specifications?
What storage conditions are specified for test strips (temperature and humidity)?
What storage conditions are specified for the meter (temperature and humidity)?
What operating temperature range is specified for the meter?
What is the minimum blood volume required for a measurement?
What is the stated lifespan of the meter?
Up to what altitude can the BG5 be used? Provide both meters and feet as printed.
Which interfering substances (name at least three) may affect results by >10% at high levels?
Name at least four patient conditions under “Limitations of Use” where the BG5 should not be used or results may be inaccurate.
What caution does the manual give about extreme hematocrit levels?
What caution does the manual give regarding oxygen therapy?
What two messages correspond to results below 20 mg/dL and above 600 mg/dL, respectively?
What action is advised when the result indicates severe hyperglycemia?
Which error message indicates the battery has insufficient power, and what is the advised action?
What environmental temperature triggers the “too low” error, and what should the user do?
What environmental temperature triggers the “too high” error, and what should the user do?
Which error message indicates that the meter’s time has not been set, and what is the fix?
What error is associated with problems related to test strip use, and what is the remedy?

In troubleshooting, what are the four solutions suggested for inconsistent results/out-of-range CS tests?
What are the three possible causes when the countdown does not start, and what’s the remedy?
What three causes are listed if the display remains blank after insertion of a strip, and what’s the first remedy?
What does the manual recommend about periodic comparison of the BG5 with another provider-maintained system?
What physical signs of device deterioration are listed, and what action is recommended if they appear?
What guidance is given about handling the meter (dropping/throwing) under “Maintenance and Storage”?
What patient populations or sample types are explicitly excluded (e.g., newborns, arterial blood)?
What are the recommended user hand-hygiene steps before handling the meter and strips?
Which symbols on the “Parts and Display Indicators” page correspond to low battery, CTL mode, and measurement units? (Name each symbol’s meaning.)
What note is repeated in both testing modes about comparing plasma-calibrated meter results to lab tests?
What brand and model of control solution is referenced, and where can additional control solution be obtained?
Which sections provide the U.S. and EU contact details for iHealth (company names and locations)?
Summarize the FCC Part 15 two operating conditions the device must comply with.
What interference-mitigation steps does the FCC section recommend if the device disrupts radio/TV reception?
Which Apple “Made for” marks are listed, and what disclaimer is provided about Apple’s responsibility and wireless performance?
